USDA extended the deadline to May 17 for agricultural producers to certify 2018 crop production for payments through the Market Facilitation Program. Producers can certify production by contacting their local FSA office or going to  http://farmers.gov  https://www.agriculture.com/crops/soybeans/usda-extends-deadline-for-producers-to-certify-2018-crop-production-for-mfp-payments …

We must ensure that the military is prepared for extreme weather as a result of climate change. 

The hearing will begin at 10 am ET on May 1, and you can watch it online at  http://CSPAN.org .

During this hearing, we will also be discussing how the Department of Defense can increase its resiliency to climate change. Natural disasters have caused billions of dollars in damage to military installations.

I look forward to learning more about planned improvements for military housing for our servicemembers and their families, and what steps have already been made to mitigate the privatized military housing crisis.

THREAD: This Wednesday, as Chairman of the House Armed Services Readiness Subcommittee, I will be leading a hearing on the Department of Defense’s budget requests for military construction, energy, and environmental programs.
I’m happy the DOD is taking this issue seriously and I will continue to conduct strong oversight of this issue until it is resolved.

Private contractors are subjecting our military families to mold, lead paint, & more. This is causing illness and even hospitalization. I brought senior representatives from the DOD before the Readiness Subcommittee and implored them to address this issue immediately.

THREAD: This year, as Chairman of the Readiness Subcommittee within the House Armed Services Committee, I’ve held several hearings on the privatized military housing crisis that’s impacting military families. pic.twitter.com/iJMlSssXjc

I’m joining @foxnewsnight at 8:35 pm PT/11:35 pm ET to discuss the SCOTUS hearing on the citizenship question in the Census. I hope you can tune in! https://twitter.com/foxnewsnight/status/1120862871137787904 …

Thank you to the incredible women who share their insight and wisdom with me through my Women’s Advisory Committee. I will take their information and voices with me to Washington.
The true power of our nation is realized when everyone, regardless of gender or income level, has an equal opportunity to succeed and operates on a level playing field.

THREAD: We just concluded a meeting with my Women’s Advisory Committee, where we discussed the recently passed Violence Against Women Act and other issues that impact women at a local and national level. pic.twitter.com/DvlvDVReSG

Today I will be commemorating this moment for the Delta with an unveiling of the National Heritage Area. If you have any questions about the National Heritage Area or this event, contact my office at (202) 225-1880. https://garamendi.house.gov/media/press-releases/president-signs-garamendi-s-delta-national-heritage-area-act-law …

Last month my legislation, the Delta National Heritage Area Act, was signed into law. This legislation establishes the Delta as the first National Heritage Area in California’s history and provides $10 million for community-based efforts to conserve the Delta’s cultural heritage.
I look forward to joining @SandraSmithFox and @BillHemmer on @AmericaNewsroom today at 11:20 am ET/8:20 am PT. https://twitter.com/AmericaNewsroom/status/1118490022414561281 …

The Trump administration’s decision to repeal net neutrality protections for Americans in 2017 had a disproportionate impact on rural communities. Today, I proudly stand with the rural communities in my district & with every American that wants equal access to affordable Internet

THREAD: Just now, I voted to reinstate net neutrality protections for Americans. Net neutrality prevents Internet Service Providers from charging consumers massive premiums to access the content they need most. pic.twitter.com/xev86WQrXi

I want to ensure that those in charge of military housing are held accountable for the safety and wellbeing of servicemembers and their families.

I want to ensure military families have access to the best possible living conditions. Sadly, that hasn’t always been the case, and I convened this hearing to ensure the Department of Defense is taking appropriate measures to address these issues.

https://www.c-span.org/video/?459341-1/pentagon-officials-testify-military-family-housing-conditions …

THREAD: Earlier today, as Chairman of the Readiness Subcommittee, I led a hearing on issues surrounding military family housing. As the Representative for the Travis and Beale AFB communities, these issues hit home for me.
